website_summaries.verdict: Fun stackable soup cans help your child build letter recognition and letter sounds.
pros: 26 cardboard "soup" cans labeled for each letter of the alphabet
Each can contains corresponding letters and photos
Use for letter learning, sound learning, or stacking
cons: Every set of cards comes in its own plastic bag, which can be tedious to remove and is not environmentally friendly

customer_reviews.title: Love!!! However too many plastic bags!!!
customer_reviews.text: My son hasn’t seen this yet... I’m really excited for him to see it. I do have one complaint... every single container has the letters and pictures wrapped in plastic... that’s 26 plastic bags!! I understand the need to keep the “cards” nice but could they use paper based products that would decompose? Seriously need to reduce one time use plastic!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Stidham

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy set
customer_reviews.text: I am an SLP. The product is way bigger than I expected. That's good in a way, the cardboard pictures are too large for kids to put in their mouths really. The set is sturdy. But its too big to do in one speech session It works better to just pull out 1 or 2 cans to work on in conjunction with your other activities. The only problem I have, is 1 of the pictures is completely round and same size as can, and it is now stuck at the bottom and I can't get it out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, wish they stacked better.
customer_reviews.text: Very cute. Wish the cans stacked better. The bottoms of the cans are almost exactly the same size as the lids outer ring/lip. So they don’t settle into each other and stack securely as you’d expect. Very hard to stack/balance as there is no way to interlock or fit cans top to bottom. But other than that very cute. Decent quality. Sturdy. Good picture examples included. We’ll enjoy these for years to come! Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Educational.
customer_reviews.text: These really helped my grandson recognize the letters quicker than any other method that we used. It's quite novel having cards enclosed for each letter with pictures of objects starting with the letter on the soup can. It's fun stacking them and making short words with them. I would recommend them to anyone interested but just know that you need a good size bin or box to store them in.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ABC learning tool
customer_reviews.text: Good item to help teach young children their letters. My three year old niece loves seeing a different can each week with different items. We use this to help introduce the new letter. The cans also have room if you want to add other small items. The only way to improve them is if the cards could somehow be waterproof. The cards are made out of cardboard and if your finger nails gets between them they can separate. The colors are vibrant. The pictures are on one side and the word of the picture on the other side.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My son was not too impressed by this. He knew all the words that was associated with the letters already. He did like collecting the letters until we got to the letter Q which was not in the box. He is obsessed with the alphabet and when he didn't get the letter Q, it made him very upset. There was two letter K's but no Q... Very disappointed mom and kid.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great phonetic learning!
customer_reviews.text: My K grandson played this with me. We used 4 letters that I realized he was struggling with - H, W, Y, and U. I scattered the pictures out & he'd pick them up, name the picture, then isolate the beginning sound. If it started with the "hhhh" sound (like a hot, panting dog), he put it in the H can. He enjoyed this challenge & caught on quickly. We'll continue to work on all the letters in small groups of 4-5 each day.
customer_reviews.author: SK D

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool.
customer_reviews.text: Abosulutely love this learning toy for my toddler, she finds it entertaining and it is highly educational. The pictures and letters are vivid. Great way for us to review the alphabet. A few of the letters have picture cards that may confuse younger children, just for example there might be a picture of a quail for the letter Q, and my toddler will see it and just say bird and will want to associate it with the letter B instead. But there are several picture cards for each letter so I just put the ambiguous ones aside. Durable as well since we do this as an activity together.
customer_reviews.author: NikkiC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome learning tools but make sure you got all letters
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 children with ASD, 2 of them are my own. This learning alphabet sorter is great and you can give them a break from all electronic devices for a bit. I received two "K"s and no "S". My son loves the product and he loves the alphabet in order. But every time he gets to "S" and there isn't any, he freaks out. So please can anyone help me by sending just the "S" container with the flashcards inside? I would appreciate it- Mrs. Sanchez
customer_reviews.author: Nahimana

customer_reviews.title: Awesome learning toy!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised to see how big the cans were upon arrival. This was a Christmas present for our 2.5 year old. She loves to just stack the cans, open the cans, find the images and letters that go with each corresponding letter. My only complaint is that the letter “X” has words and images that do not start with the letter “X” which could be confusing to some kids. Otherwise, this is worthy buy!
customer_reviews.author: MrsRyan09

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Not as fun as I had hoped. Cans are soup can sized so storage is going to be a problem since it just comes in a cardboard box that won't last long. Wouldn't have minded the size, but since they aren't very fun it kind of sucks. Definitely NOT worth $40.
customer_reviews.author: V. Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Great but missing pieces and too much plastic
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tool for our homeschooling preschool, but I’m disappointed to find it’s missing pieces. Came with two “X” sets and no “W.” I’ve tried contacting the company with no luck. Also... It might sound knit picky but there’s WAY too much plastic in this packaging. Each set of letter/picture boards are packaged in an individual plastic bag, inside each soup can. 26 unnecessary single use plastic bags. That alone wouldn’t deduct stars from my review, but it’s something I wish they’d change. If I had all the pieces I would say 5 starts.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Schanz

customer_reviews.title: Good teaching resource
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for our 3 year old grandson for Christmas. Confirmed with daughter that it would be okay. He's just a sponge now when it comes to learning so this should be a benefit. Based on other reviews with checked every can to make sure we had all the letters and the insides matched. All were in tip top shape and where they belonged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Your class will love it . Please buy it . It’s s great resource
customer_reviews.text: We love this product. I used it to teach the alphabet, identifying words and sounds . It was a hit in my classroom. Student pick one word that begins the the letter of the week and say the name of the picture on their card . They would come to the white board and write their word .
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful homeschooling tool
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my 2 and 4 year olds for homeschooling. My 2 year old does object to picture match. My 4 year old sorts by beginning sound, and also spells words with her moveable alphabet letters. I love that the pictures are real, not drawings
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great for Learning- Missing Pieces
customer_reviews.text: This set has been amazing for teaching my daughter letter recognition and letter sounds... all except for one letter, Z. We received a set with two sets of y and no z. Learning resources was cordial over the phone and said they would send a new Z if I emailed them with a photo. I did, twice, but received no reply...
customer_reviews.author: W. Gabonay

customer_reviews.title: Very cute!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice set! The only complaint I have is some of the pieces are too big to just drop into the cup. You have to shove them in and sometimes makes the kid hard to get back on. Other than that it’s very cute and sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: UMMM MAYBE THESE SELLERS NEED A LESSON IN THEIR ALPHABET!!!
customer_reviews.text: Missing 7 of the letters!! I needed this for school yesterday and I ordered it on time! However there are 7 SEVEN letters missing!!! What THE HECK?!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashel5

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.  Exciting learning toy for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, very cute and my son was excited from the moment he saw them. My only complaint was that each can had the cards individually wrapped inside which was a waste of a ton of plastic and time to open then. But overall fun and solid quality.
customer_reviews.author: DanaK

customer_reviews.title: The kids loved it and they even noticed that on the back ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great- both the picture quality and can/chipboard pictures seem very durable. NOTE not indestructible but durable/ish . As a k teacher I was able to split up the contents of the individual cans amongst 5 ziplock baggies so that 5 separate groups can each work with a bag and then we can have centers and alphabet relay races with their chipboard objects! The kids loved it and they even noticed that on the back of each picture is a word that corresponds to the image and that word has a highlighted letter that they can also use to cross check! .Great price as well for what you get!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Daughter likes it
customer_reviews.text: He’s a really great we set them up on a bookshelf and each night my daughter gets to choose one. She loves being able to learn her letters and then identify those leaders later on and other books or as we go shopping. It’s a really nice way to have a short lesson that is already prepared for your child.
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: Missing cutouts for letter “K”
customer_reviews.text: Received two sets of letter “L” cutouts and missing cutouts for letter “K”.
customer_reviews.author: BiancaMedMar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for early learners!
customer_reviews.text: These are adorable and perfect for my kindergarten classroom! The cans are large enough that I can put some other small items in there that start with each letter.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Love this set!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this set to give to my 25 month old for christmas. So far he loves going through each can. He already knows his alphabet so these are great for building his vocabulary while also working on phonics at the same time! I have started to add small trinkets to each can to build up for if a vocab “inventory” and make it more fun! Overall we get a lot of use out of these and it’s easy to keep my toddlers attention!
customer_reviews.author: H.B.

customer_reviews.title: Cool Product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my day care and I love them. All the cans have lovely images and letters in them to help the children learn and read them. Super fun learning toy. The box even had some ideas for learning games and stuff with it! I think that is really cool!
customer_reviews.author: Ivy Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Awesome addition to learning the alphabet! Some of the pieces don’t go back in the containers easily. But it’s a great little learning tool!
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Weldon

customer_reviews.title: Buy them! Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: These are working great to teach my four-year-old sounds of letters! Great learning tool
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great for learning but takes up lots of space.
customer_reviews.text: I love these for my toddler. The letters in both capital and lowercase as well as the words associated with the letter are very sturdy. My only complaint about this product is the cans aren't easily stacked and the entire alphabet takes up a ton of room. I would have given this product a 5 star rating if the cans could stack on top of each other instead of staggered.
customer_reviews.author: Lori J McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: We use this for our preschoolers and they love it. This is always what they ask for during circle time.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Still it is a great price for such a game
customer_reviews.text: I guess I thought it had real things in it, but there are just pictures of things that start with the different letters. Still it is a great price for such a game. My students enjoyed it and the cans are heavy duty cardboard. I think they will last a long time. The pictures are also heavy cardboard.
customer_reviews.author: SMack

customer_reviews.title: Great visual
customer_reviews.text: These will be perfect to use with my students as they learn their alphabet.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Cute product. There are 26 cans the actual size ...
customer_reviews.text: Cute product. There are 26 cans the actual size of a soup can though, so it requires some room and forethought. You'll want to remove some cards for younger kids or it will just be too many things to manipulate at once.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my two year old niece, and once she opened this it was the only thing she was interested in!!! She spent more than an hour going through each can and naming the pieces! Let me tell you... that is a remarkable length of time for a little girl her age! The best part is that it will grow with her! She will be able to use the set for many educational activities in the future, and I can't wait until my little lady gets a little bigger so I can get her a set too!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Great Learning Game!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to keep at my house to work with my 3 year old grandson. He and I are now in the process of adding things that start with the letter and then add it to the appropriate letter can. He considers it a special things to work with MiMi and the Alphabet Cans.
customer_reviews.author: Linda RTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: great concept, great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: great concept, great learning tool...a pain in the butt to clean up since there are so many pieces to this, but if your kids actually listen to you and will clean up themselves, then buy this
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely adores this!!! He's developmentally delayed and his language development shot through the roof with these! 2 years later and it's still a great go-to! I highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Domino73

customer_reviews.title: Two A’s, no “T” (Incomplete)
customer_reviews.text: I wish all the letters actually come in the box. I received two “A”s and no “T”. The whole point is so they memorize their alphabet letters, and how would they do that, if they are incomplete. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Yamilet

customer_reviews.title: Missing part
customer_reviews.text: Did not receive all letters of the alphabet and a letter was duplicated. No logical way to request replacement can without returning whole box which is next to impossible once opened and toddler is playing with it. Otherwise, great learning toy but the fact that it is not as specified knocks this down to a 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: E-Money

customer_reviews.title: This curriculum is fun yet allows him to learn new words
customer_reviews.text: My son speaks a foreign language strictly at home and we are playing catch up on his English. This curriculum is fun yet allows him to learn new words. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Although the items inside are picture cards you can't beat it for the price! Several reviews complained about lids not fitting, I've never had a problem! I also have the counting cans! Awesome product. Would like to see actual items like the counting cans when updated
customer_reviews.author: sunshine 71

customer_reviews.title: Great alphabet teaching tool
customer_reviews.text: Great alphabet teaching tool. Only problem is if you are doing the phonic approach the i pics are mostly ice cream, iron and u is unicorn, etc
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Bigger than the pictures
customer_reviews.text: I love it! My daughter loves it and I can’t wait to use this product with my pre k class. Cans are not small. It’s a little pricey but I’m a 100% satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Keturah Harris

customer_reviews.title: I wish it came with a small item for each letter but it was easy enough to add my own
customer_reviews.text: My son loves doing "His school" with his containers. He gets the items out of the box and lays them all out and sorts them over and over. I wish it came with a small item for each letter but it was easy enough to add my own.
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: Nice educational product
customer_reviews.text: Great product but I wished it was make in a water proof material
customer_reviews.author: Cindy S.

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Alphabet Learning Toy
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES this! All “J” pictures had incorrect words on the back. I emailed the company... and they sent the correct ones immediately! Such a wonderful learning tool! Definitely will buy again from this company!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie L Casey

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Learning Tool
customer_reviews.text: Super fun for toddler to learn the alphabet. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: miranda parker

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kindergarten Centers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Kindergarten class. It is perfect for "centers" and small group discussions. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy W

customer_reviews.title: Missing Soup Can Letter U!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great learning tool for my toddler. But it didn't have all the letters. It came with 2 cans of S's and were missing letter U. Didn't have time to return so we just worked with what we had. Other than that we love It! It is a fun tool to use for phonics learning.
customer_reviews.author: ChadandShay

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing product. Love how it helps teach the alphabet and phonics. Lots to keep your little one busy. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: dale kanaski

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyday play
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great product if the cans were made more durable. The kids for the cans are more durable than the actual cans. Especially when these were designed for repetitive play. It looks like the cans were made of cardboard tubes.
customer_reviews.author: T. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Kinders don't use.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty flimsy. My k. class isn't interested in it. Thought it would be better items to sort.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Ridgers

customer_reviews.title: Good product and good price for it
customer_reviews.text: It is extremely educational for kids and the value was amazing. So happy I found this product at amazon for less and something that I use everyday at my class.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good engaging product for learning letter sounds
customer_reviews.text: This is really helpful for my 3 year old. We homeschool and my son is resistant to learning his ABC's for some reason. He is more interested in learning the sounds with the picture cards and the special soup cans. since there are several cards with picures of items that begin with that letter, he is grasping the concept. I incorporate some household items and stray toys into the cans to further reinforce the letter sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Bankes

customer_reviews.title: My kindergarten class LOVES these. I am not sure ...
customer_reviews.text: My kindergarten class LOVES these. I am not sure how long they will last because everything is made out of cardboard. For the price it is well worth it and makes my classroom look adorable
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Grove

customer_reviews.title: Came with two 'T' cans and no 'C' can
customer_reviews.text: My autistic son really likes this set. I was slightly disappointed that there were two 't' cans and no 'c' because the first thing he wanted to do with the cans was line them up in alphabetical order and ran into a roadblock immediately.
customer_reviews.author: julia molnar

customer_reviews.title: my kids love them though
customer_reviews.text: Only thing i would change is include little toy trinkets instead of all cardboard cut outs. my kids love them though.
customer_reviews.author: Angel  P St.Louis

customer_reviews.title: great idea
customer_reviews.text: Loved the soup cans. Great way for sorting and learning beginning sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Debk

customer_reviews.title: Teaching tool!
customer_reviews.text: I teach ESL and these are great for learning the letters and items that begin with the letter!
customer_reviews.author: star

customer_reviews.title: Great way to
customer_reviews.text: Great for kids that like interactive toys... every letter has capital and lower case and several examples that start with the letter. Super cool. Can be messy with small children.
customer_reviews.author: Belkenia Candelario

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: My family is really enjoying these with our 4 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Calderon

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Cardboard. I hate that the x doesn’t have words that begin with x. It has words that have x in them.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Burns

customer_reviews.title: Open to verify pieces
customer_reviews.text: This is a great educational product; however, I opened after the return date to find the box included two letter H cans and is missing the letter J can. Be sure not to make my mistake and to open immediately to verify your box has all of the letters!
customer_reviews.author: Crysta Carducci

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: My kids (3 and 1) both love these letters. We spend time every day opening the cans. I only wish the cardboard cans were more sturdy. Great learning tool.
customer_reviews.author: Spnshpr

customer_reviews.title: This is a great set! The cans are much larger and higher ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set! The cans are much larger and higher quality than anticipated. It's a great way to introduce kids to the letters, their sounds and initial phoneme sounds. Great for kids to practice sorting as well. The company also has amazing customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Oneill

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Has a bunch of cards per container so that's awesome. Box it came it was pretty unsturdy, borderline used? But it looks as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Maria Loginova

customer_reviews.title: Came with items in cans not matching letter on outside ...
customer_reviews.text: Came with items in cans not matching letter on outside of can Granddaughter likes to play with the letter soup cans
customer_reviews.author: Laura Crowe

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great intro for letter of the week! Classroom splurge but worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Marrie

customer_reviews.title: Great Ideal
customer_reviews.text: This product is something like what my son had when he was little but they used alph buddies. Great tool to use.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Barton

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun for my preschooler
customer_reviews.text: We're excited to introduce a fun way to learn letters with our preschooler. She is struggling to learn and apply letters to words and thought we would introduce this game. So far she's enjoying it and wants to play with it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Little bigger then the ave soup can. and they ...
customer_reviews.text: Little bigger then the ave soup can. and they are in a box that doesnt work well for storage. so i had to find another way to store them.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Circle time
customer_reviews.text: I own a in home day care. We love using these for our circle time and focus for the week
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Maria

customer_reviews.title: Kids Enjoy It
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to order this for my kids, but when they came in, I just wasn't as thrilled. My kids like it. They ask to play with them a couple times a couple times a week. We only play with a few cans at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Henson

customer_reviews.title: I like this change because it reachrs every level of student ...
customer_reviews.text: They replaced the manipulatives with shaped picture cards an the word on the back. I like this change because it reachrs every level of student ability.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Alphabet soup letters help children make connections with letters and d
customer_reviews.text: As a 4K teacher these are very helpful in allowing children to become engaged in learning alphabet sounds ands letter recognition.
customer_reviews.author: kimbee41

customer_reviews.title: Nice product but was missing some letters and got double of others.
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. The only problem is I received double of letters and was missing others. Super bummed about that.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn P.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced for what it is, basically just cardboard cutouts of things that start with each letter of the alphabet.
customer_reviews.author: Aileen

customer_reviews.title: Great to learn beginning letter sounds!
customer_reviews.text: This set has made it through all 3 of my children. I home school my kids and have used it as a hands on way to learn beginning letter sounds of words. The pieces are made from a very thick cardboard that has really withstood heavy wear over time.
customer_reviews.author: kbrenneman83

customer_reviews.title: open all the letters when you get it!!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for my preschool. This is the second time I have come to a letter with a duplicate letter. K has L. L has L. I have no K. boo!
customer_reviews.author: janine wilson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent toy and great customer service from Learning Resources. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Wrigglesworth Family

customer_reviews.title: My daughter is not very interested in it. I ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is not very interested in it. I find the soup containers too large for the items inside. These are in a large box and just be aware it takes up space.
customer_reviews.author: Nellie

customer_reviews.title: These are not as good as I'd hoped for
customer_reviews.text: These are not as good as I'd hoped for. The pieces are not magnetic . Poor quality, high price. DO NOT recommend. Wish I had returned this product.
customer_reviews.author: sbrooks

customer_reviews.title: Great product, missing letter Y
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this set in my storytimes, and every week we are learning about a different letter. Just noticed, however, that my set is missing the letter "Y", and I can't seem to locate the manufacturer information to remedy this.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Good concept...poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: This looked so promising to me. The phonics games you can create out of it are endless, however, the quality isn't that great. The lids don't fit properly on many of the cans and some of them are dented a bit (they are only made out of cardboard). The letters/pictures aren't the best quality either...they have wrinkles and bends in the carboard. I'm not thrilled with the quality of it, but I love the idea of it.
customer_reviews.author: Mum-Mum

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Such a good product for the price. Wish it had 3D objects, not just the board pictures, but it is still a really good product.
customer_reviews.author: hilary

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts and can’t contact seller.
customer_reviews.text: This was missing the letter M and had two letter Q’s. To add to the frustration there is no way, that I found, to contact seller to find a solution to this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jana

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loved these. The cut outs inside are great and ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loved these. The cut outs inside are great and have the capital and small letters. The cans are also sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jenae Wills

customer_reviews.title: A to Z?  Think again!
customer_reviews.text: Can't give this gift for Christmas due to there being 2 "E" cans and no "F" can.... Only option is to return whole thing to amazon. Lousy timing! You would think a company named Learning Resources would "learn" to pack this kit correctly by now!!! Lids fit poorly, cans looked like they were old concentrated OJ cans, but not as sturdy...Pathetic how expensive this set is for what you really get. Will be looking elsewhere for "resources"...Sad!
customer_reviews.author: A. Thankful

customer_reviews.title: Missing Letters
customer_reviews.text: This is a great learning tool for kids, IF all the letters of the alphabet were included. We got two D’s and no O.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: just depends on child I think
customer_reviews.text: We haven't use these a lot but she is just now in kindergarten so maybe now they will be more helpful. Not cheap and they are made of cardboard
customer_reviews.author: grammyd

customer_reviews.title: Thank you
customer_reviews.text: Invaluable resource to use when teaching ABC's to kindergarteners. It was affordable and easy to order with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mariann Brown

customer_reviews.title: great toy for kids
customer_reviews.text: this is a great learning toy for my pre-k child. this is my second favorite toy company beside melissa and doug. pieces are small so i would not recommend it if you have a child that likes to put things in his or her mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Want my money back
customer_reviews.text: Worst cheap smashed product ever...pretty much every can was majorly squished Or ATLEAST dented... and 6 cans came With no lid
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Cute game!
customer_reviews.text: The cans are an adorable idea. The picture pieces are somewhat sturdy cardboard.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Recieved 2 M cans and no W
customer_reviews.text: Just opened this to use with my preschool class and was very excited. Great, clear photos, well organized packaging. However, the can that should be a "W" is an "M". Hoping to get a replacement can soon.
customer_reviews.author: YM

customer_reviews.title: ABC
customer_reviews.text: I loved the product, I can use it with my kids during virtual classes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Would be nice if the containers had some 3-D items for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia R. Lange

customer_reviews.title: Not complete
customer_reviews.text: The letter C can has letter G in it. Went through the whole alphabet. No C in sight. I have 2 sets of G stuff. Please send the C. Frustrating as I am teaching C this week. 😣
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great concept
customer_reviews.text: Helps my son with learning his letters and sounds based on the pictures with each letter.
customer_reviews.author: Dimples2378

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, good price. Just what I wanted for my classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Bjorback

customer_reviews.title: Missing G letters and pic cards.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the G can did not come with G letter and G object cards. There was the letter C in the G can.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

product_meta.title: Learning Resources Alphabet Soup Sorters, Early Phonics, ABCs, Alphabet Awareness & Recognition, 208 Pieces, Ages 3+
product_meta.description:
Size:3 L x 4-1/4 W inSupport alphabet awareness by recognizing letter sounds and shapes. Also builds early vocabulary, oral language, sorting, and fine motor skills. Set includes 26 durable cardboard cans with plastic lids, 130 die-cut photo cards, 52 letter cards, and activity guide.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Alphabet Soup Sorters. Cook up early literacy skills. Each can holds 1 uppercase and 1 lowercase letter, plus 5 object cards featuring real-life photos on one side, words on reverse. Support alphabet awareness, letter sounds and recognition of letter shapes. Also builds early vocabulary, oral language, sorting and fine motor skills. Includes 130 die-cut photo cards, 52 color-coded letters (red vowels, blue consonants) and 26 durable cardboard cans with lids. Activity Guide includes intervention strategies. Measure 3" in diameter x 4 1/4"H. Grades PreK+. Set of 26.
feature_bullets: Promote school readiness with activities that support alphabet awareness, letter recognition, early phonics, and reading
Build vocabulary while encouraging sorting, fine motor, language, memory, and recall skills
Set includes 26 durable cardboard cans with plastic lids, 130 die-cut photo cards, 52 letter cards, and activity guide
